docs.snippet: THERE are few countries in the world where national and municipal statistics are more carefully compiled and more elaborately presented than in the Argentine Republic. Yet it is a curious fact that although the era of modern Argentina began when...
docs.lead_paragraph: THERE are few countries in the world where national and municipal statistics are more carefully compiled and more elaborately presented than in the Argentine Republic. Yet it is a curious fact that although the era of modern Argentina began when Sarmiento assumed the Presidency of the republic, in 1868, only two national censuses have been taken since that time, one in 1869 and the next in 1895.

headline.main: ARGENTINE A FINE FIELD FOR INVESTORS, SAYS GEN. REYES; Amazing Prosperity and Stable Government of This Most Pushing of South American Republics Make It Ideal for Introduction of Foreign Capital, According to Former President of Colombia.

byline.original: By Gen. Rafael Reyes, Ex-President of the United States of Colombia

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18. -- Should Harry K. Thaw find refuge in a foreign country, officials of the Government assert, he will be free from extradition on grounds of insanity. None of the treaties of the United States with any foreign nation provide for...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 18. -- Should Harry K. Thaw find refuge in a foreign country, officials of the Government assert, he will be free from extradition on grounds of insanity. None of the treaties of the United States with any foreign nation provide for extradition of insane persons or alleged lunatics.
docs.abstract: Extradition treaties with only nine countries include bribery clauses

headline.main: NOT SAFE IN THESE COUNTRIES; Under Treaty Clauses Nine Nations Would Give Him Up for Bribery.

docs.snippet: IT HAS been said by a famous writer that the blood that has been shed in Latin-American revolutions would form but a small rivulet in comparison with the oceans of blood that have been shed in Europe to indulge the ambitions of despots, or to satisfy...
docs.lead_paragraph: IT HAS been said by a famous writer that the blood that has been shed in Latin-American revolutions would form but a small rivulet in comparison with the oceans of blood that have been shed in Europe to indulge the ambitions of despots, or to satisfy the righteous claims of freedom.

docs.snippet: Roger C. Sullivan, the leader of the Cook County Democracy of Illinois, arrived here on the Lusitania yesterday after a four-months' trip through South America and Europe, and was escorted by the better half of Cook County officials from the Cunard...
docs.lead_paragraph: Roger C. Sullivan, the leader of the Cook County Democracy of Illinois, arrived here on the Lusitania yesterday after a four-months' trip through South America and Europe, and was escorted by the better half of Cook County officials from the Cunard pier to the Waldorf-Astoria.
docs.abstract: arrives in New York, received by Cook County friends, gives opinions on public officials

headline.main: COOK COUNTY COMES FOR ROGER SULLIVAN; He Has Been About Half Around the World and the Faithful Greet His Return.

docs.snippet: Edmund Copeland, 5 years old, and Beatrice Reitzes, 6 years old, were the causes of keeping the Supreme Court open yesterday afternoon on a Saturday half holiday. Both children were the subject of writs of habeas corpus sued out by warring parents....
docs.lead_paragraph: Edmund Copeland, 5 years old, and Beatrice Reitzes, 6 years old, were the causes of keeping the Supreme Court open yesterday afternoon on a Saturday half holiday. Both children were the subject of writs of habeas corpus sued out by warring parents. In each case Justice Donnelly upheld the old maxim that "possession is nine points of the law," and ruled against the unlucky parents who brought the writs.
docs.abstract: court gives her possession of child

headline.main: COURT SITS LATE IN CHILDREN'S CASES; Justice Donnelly Gives Up Half-Holiday to Rule on Habeas Corpus Writs.

docs.snippet: BOLIVIA is a country of contrasts. Its topography, climate, products and inhabitants constitute an aggregation of heterogeneous elements so widely different in character as to make it difficult to believe that they belong to single country.
docs.lead_paragraph: BOLIVIA is a country of contrasts. Its topography, climate, products and inhabitants constitute an aggregation of heterogeneous elements so widely different in character as to make it difficult to believe that they belong to single country.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10. -- President Wilson showed to-day that he intended to eliminate politics from the United States Consular service and to recognize the merit system in making appointments. The evidence lay in the fact that of thirty men nominated...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 10. -- President Wilson showed to-day that he intended to eliminate politics from the United States Consular service and to recognize the merit system in making appointments. The evidence lay in the fact that of thirty men nominated to the Senate for Consular posts twenty-eight were in the service, and the two others had passed examinations for appointments to such positions.
docs.abstract: list of thirty men chosen as Consuls and Consul Generals sent to Senate; nominations made on merit

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27. -- Exports from the United States to Latin America averaged $1,000,000 for every business day during the last fiscal year according to a statement issued by the Department of Commerce yesterday. The total was $321,000,000 as...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 27. -- Exports from the United States to Latin America averaged $1,000,000 for every business day during the last fiscal year according to a statement issued by the Department of Commerce yesterday. The total was $321,000,000 as compared with $108,000,000 during the previous year.

headline.main: LATIN-AMERICAN TRADE.; Shipments from the United States Average $1,000,000 a Day.
